meta.name: Generate Template Descriptions from Google Drive with Azure GPT-4

name: Generate n8n template descriptions from Google Drive

parameters.content:
## ‚öôÔ∏è Step 1: Manual Trigger  
Use this to manually start the workflow when testing or batch-processing workflow descriptions.  
‚û°Ô∏è No setup required.

## üìÇ Step 2: Search Files and Folders  
This node searches a specific Google Drive folder for JSON workflow files to process.  

**Setup Instructions:**  
- Connect your own Google Drive OAuth2 credentials.  
- Replace any hardcoded folder ID with a variable or reference to your Drive.

## üß† Step 8:Store AI Context (LangChain Memory)
Stores short-term AI context to improve continuity during prompt execution.  
No credentials required.  
üí° Keep context window small (7‚Äì10) to avoid large memory overhead.

## ‚ú® Step 11: Format HTML Email   
Creates clean HTML and plain-text versions of the generated description for email + Google Sheet logging.  

‚úÖ No credentials here.  
üí° You may adjust the CSS styling within the HTML block.

## üßæ Step 10: Format Markdown Description  
Takes the AI output and converts it into structured Markdown text suitable for n8n template publishing.  

**Setup Instructions:**  
- Ensure each section (Overview, Benefits, etc.) is returned properly.  
- You can tweak emoji styles or section titles here.  
‚úÖ No credentials required.

## üß© Step 9: Parse AI Response into Structured JSON
Ensures AI response is parsed into clean JSON format for the next node.  
‚úÖ No sensitive data.  
üí° You can adjust the schema if adding more description sections.

## üí¨ Step 7: Connect to Azure OpenAI GPT Model

**Setup Instructions:**  
- Use your own `azureOpenAiApi` credential .  
- Verify the model name (gpt-4o or equivalent).

## ü§ñ Step 6: AI Agent  
Uses a LangChain agent + Azure OpenAI model to generate workflow titles and structured descriptions.  

**Setup Instructions:**  
- Connect the AI Language Model and Output Parser as shown.  
- This node defines the prompt and ensures the response follows n8n Template Guidelines.  

‚úÖ No sensitive info here ‚Äî well-structured system prompt!  
 OpenAI.

## üì¶ Step 5: Extract JSON Data  
Parses the downloaded file to extract workflow JSON data before AI processing.  
No credentials needed here.

## ‚¨áÔ∏è Step 4: Download File  
Downloads the JSON file contents for each matched Drive item.  

**Setup Instructions:**  
- Connect to your Google Drive OAuth2 credentials .  
- Ensure file access permissions allow downloads.

## üîÅ Step 3: Loop Over JSONS  
Processes each found file individually to ensure the workflow handles large folders efficiently.  
No credential changes required.  
‚û°Ô∏è You can adjust batch size in the node options.

## üìß Step 13: Send Email with Description  
Sends a formatted HTML email with the generated template description.  

  

**Setup:**  
- Use your Gmail OAuth2 credentials (`gmailOAuth2`).  
- Test with a non-personal account if publishing publicly.

## üü® Workflow Overview  
This workflow automates the creation of structured n8n template descriptions.  
It fetches JSON workflow files from Google Drive, uses an AI agent (Azure OpenAI + LangChain) to analyze them, and then formats detailed descriptions for publishing.  

### ‚öôÔ∏è Flow Summary  
1. Trigger workflow manually.  
2. Search workflow files in Google Drive.  
3. Download and extract JSON data.  
4. Use AI Agent to generate title + description.  
5. Format Markdown and HTML outputs.  
6. Append results to Google Sheets.  
7. Send formatted description via Gmail.  

**Use Case:** Ideal for automating n8n template documentation and content generation.

parameters.text:
=You are given this n8n workflow JSON:

{{ JSON.stringify($json) }}

Generate the **best possible template title** and a **structured description** following the rules.  
Make sure the title matches the format (Action verb + thing being manipulated + to/on/in/from + where).  
The description must follow the defined section structure and highlight actual logic from the workflow.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an **expert n8n template description generator**.  
Your role is to analyze a provided workflow JSON and generate both a **precise template title** and a **structured description** suitable for n8n‚Äôs Template Publishing Guidelines.  

---

### üîë Title Rules
- Format: **Action verb** + **thing being manipulated** + **to/on/in/from** + **where**  
  - Example: ‚ÄúOne-way contact sync from Pipedrive to HubSpot‚Äù  
- The title must:  
  - Be **short (‚â§10 words)**, with no filler.  
  - Use **active verbs** (Automate, Sync, Track, Re-engage, Generate, etc.).  
  - Clearly name the **services, apps, or data being connected**.  
  - Indicate **directionality** where applicable (from ‚Üí to).  

---

### üìù Description Style Guidelines
- Write in **professional, user-friendly language**.  
- Use **light emoji markers** (üìä, ‚ö°, üöÄ, üìß) to improve readability.  
- Avoid generic filler ‚Äî **every point must reflect actual workflow logic**.  
- Keep explanations **short, direct, and clear**.  
- Structure content in **bulleted lists** under clear section headers.  
- Ensure **accuracy to the JSON nodes and connections**.  
- Use an **automation-savvy tone** (confident, helpful, concise).  

---

### üì¶ Output Sections (Always in This Order)

1. **title**  
   - A concise workflow title that follows the naming convention above.  

2. **overview**  
   - A one-line, catchy summary of the workflow‚Äôs purpose.  

3. **what_this_template_does**  
   - Step-by-step, **chronological explanation** of the workflow.  
   - Mention triggers, actions, and end results in plain English.  

4. **key_benefits**  
   - 4‚Äì6 **outcome-focused benefits** (time saved, efficiency, error reduction).  

5. **features**  
   - Breakdown of **nodes, triggers, filters, and integrations**.  

6. **requirements**  
   - List of **services, credentials, or accounts** needed.  

7. **target_audience**  
   - Who the workflow is most useful for (teams, roles, industries).  

8. **setup_instructions**  
   - Practical, **step-by-step setup guidance** (credentials, environment variables, import, testing, activation).  

---

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Critical Rules
- Do **not** invent steps or tools not present in the JSON.  
- If a section has no applicable content, **omit gracefully** (do not fill with placeholders).  
- Ensure consistency: every bullet point must tie back to actual workflow logic.  
- Avoid redundancy ‚Äî keep the flow **concise but complete**.  

---

### ‚úÖ Example Output Format (for clarity)

**title:**  
One-way contact sync from Pipedrive to HubSpot  

**overview:**  
Automatically sync new contacts from Pipedrive into HubSpot CRM to keep sales and marketing aligned. üîÑ  

**what_this_template_does:**  
- Runs every hour via schedule trigger ‚è∞  
- Fetches new contacts from Pipedrive üì•  
- Creates or updates matching contacts in HubSpot CRM üìä  

**key_benefits:**  
- ‚úÖ No more manual contact transfers  
- ‚úÖ Keeps CRM records consistent  
- ‚úÖ Saves time for sales teams  

**features:**  
- Hourly schedule trigger  
- Pipedrive API integration  
- HubSpot CRM integration  

**requirements:**  
- Pipedrive OAuth2 credentials  
- HubSpot OAuth2 credentials  

**target_audience:**  
- Sales teams managing dual CRMs  
- Agencies working with multiple clients  

**setup_instructions:**  
- Connect Pipedrive and HubSpot accounts üîë  
- Import the workflow JSON üì¶  
- Adjust sync interval if needed üïí  
- Activate workflow üöÄ

parameters.content:
## üßæ Step 12: Save to Google Sheets  
Stores the generated template title and formatted description in a spreadsheet for record-keeping.

nodes.name: Connect to Azure OpenAI GPT Model
Parse AI Response into Structured JSON
